text: Susan Merdinger (born October 29, 1962) is an American classical pianist, music director, and educator. Merdinger won a Gold medal at the Global Music Awards in 2014. == Education == Merdinger graduated from Yale University, the Yale School of Music, the Manhattan School of Music, the Westchester Conservatory of Music, and the École Normale de Musique in Fontainebleau, France. == Career == Merdinger won Gold Medals in the 2014 Global Music Awards for her French Fantasy (Piano Duet) CD and in 2019 for her American Melting Pot [Live] CD, the Honored Artist Award of the American Prize in 2020, 2nd Prize in the Lorin Hollander Piano Concerto Award for her live concert performance of Brahms' Second Piano Concerto with the Northbrook Symphony Orchestra, and 3rd Prize in the Ernst Bacon Award for American Music with the 2020 American Melting Pot CD, First Prize in the 2017 and 2012 Bradshaw and Buono International Piano Competition (in the Solo and Duo Piano divisions), the Dewar’s Young Artist Award in Music (1990), as well as Artists International Young Musicians Competition (1986) and Artists International Distinguished Alumni Award (1990).{{cite web|work =Chicago Classical Review |title =Pianissimo|url = http://chicagoclassicalreview.com/2015/09/pianissimo- offers-a-mixed-bag-of-multiple-piano-music/ Merdinger is Founder and Artistic Director of Sheridan Music Studio LLC, in Highland Park and Chicago.
